meanings.definition: The place where one lives permanently, especially as a member of a family or household.
meanings.sent1: My home is cozy and warm.
meanings.sent2: I can't wait to go back home after school.
meanings.sent3: The cat made our home its own.
meanings.sent4: Her smile felt like coming home after a long journey.
meanings.sent5: The old oak tree stood tall next to our home.

meanings.definition: A place where something flourishes, is most typically found, or from which it originates.
meanings.sent1: The forest is the home of many animals.
meanings.sent2: The library is the home of knowledge.
meanings.sent3: The garden is the home of colorful flowers.
meanings.sent4: The river is the home of the elusive otter.
meanings.sent5: The classroom is the home of learning and growth.

meanings.definition: To return by instinct to its territory after leaving it.
meanings.sent1: The bird will home to its nest at dusk.
meanings.sent2: The salmon will home to the same river to spawn.
meanings.sent3: The lost dog managed to home despite being far away.
meanings.sent4: The migrating geese will home to their breeding grounds.
meanings.sent5: The bees will home to their hive with nectar for the queen.
